alert.note: Alert for Butler; Conecuh; Covington; Crenshaw; Monroe; Wilcox (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 08 at 1:28PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT BUTLER...NORTHEASTERN MONROE... CENTRAL CRENSHAW...SOUTHEASTERN WILCOX...NORTHEASTERN CONECUH AND NORTHWESTERN COVINGTON COUNTIES THROUGH 215 PM CDT... At 127 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Fort Deposit to 12 miles north of Evergreen. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 40 to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Greenville, Georgiana, McKenzie, Rutledge, Pine Apple, and Highland Home. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Butler; Conecuh; Covington; Crenshaw; Monroe; Wilcox
